data.enText: gas
the mixture of gases that surrounds the earth and that we breathe
air pollution

data.chText: 咱们出去呼吸点新鲜空气。
data.enText: Let's go out for some fresh air .

data.chText: 我需要给我的轮胎打些气。
data.enText: I need to put some air in my tyres.
currents of warm air
space
the space above the ground or that is around things

data.chText: 我把球高高地踢到空中。
data.enText: I kicked the ball high in/into the air .

data.chText: 空中飘来一阵阵辛辣的气味。
data.enText: Spicy smells wafted through the air .
Music filled the night air.
for planes
the space above the earth where planes fly
It only takes three hours by air (= in a plane) .
air travel/traffic

data.chText: 从空中看去，那座庙宇清晰可辨。
data.enText: The temple was clearly visible from the air.
A surprise air attack (= from aircraft) was launched at night.
impression
the particular feeling or impression that is given by sb/sth; the way sb does sth
The room had an air of luxury.

data.chText: 她用蔑视的神情望着他。
data.enText: She looked at him with a defiant air.
tune

before.enText: often used in the title of a piece of music

data.enText: a tune
Bach's Air on a G string
behaviour
a way of behaving that shows that sb thinks that they are more important, etc. than they really are

data.chText: 我不喜欢她那装腔作势的样子。
data.enText: I hate the way she puts on airs .
airs and graces
a way of behaving that shows that sb thinks that they are more important, etc. than they really are
float/walk on air
to feel very happy
in the air

data.chText: 在传播中；流行；可感觉到的
data.enText: felt by a number of people to exist or to be happening
There's romance in the air.
on/off (the) air

data.chText: 正在 / 停止播送（电视、广播）
data.enText: broadcasting or not broadcasting on television or radio

data.chText: 明天早上7点本节目重新开播。
data.enText: We will be back on air tomorrow morning at 7.
The programme was taken off the air over the summer.
up in the air
not yet decided

data.chText: 我们的旅行计划尚未决定。
data.enText: Our travel plans are still up in the air.
a breath of (fresh) air
clean air breathed in after being indoors or in a dirty atmosphere

data.chText: 我们午餐时出去透透气。
data.enText: We'll get a breath of fresh air at lunchtime.
(build) castles in the air
(to have) plans or dreams that are not likely to happen or come true
clear the air

data.chText: （通过倾诉）改变困境，缓解紧张状态，改善气氛
data.enText: to improve a difficult or tense situation by talking about worries, doubts, etc.
with your nose in the air

data.chText: 傲慢；看不起人；鼻孔朝天，自高自大
data.enText: in a way that is unfriendly and suggests that you think that you are better than other people
pluck sth out of the air
to say a name, number, etc. without thinking about it, especially in answer to a question

data.chText: 我随口说出一个数字问道：“你看1 000英镑合适吗？”
data.enText: I just plucked a figure out of the air and said : ‘Would £1 000 seem reasonable to you?’
disappear, vanish, etc. into thin air

data.chText: 消失得无影无踪；不翼而飞；悄然而逝
data.enText: to disappear suddenly in a mysterious way
clothes
to put clothing, etc. in a place that is warm or has plenty of air so that it dries completely and smells fresh; to be left to dry somewhere

data.chText: 把这些床单好好晾晒一下。
data.enText: Air the sheets well.
Leave the towels out to air.
a room
air (sth) out
to allow fresh air into a room or a building; to be filled with fresh air

data.chText: 所有的房间都已打扫干净并且通了风。
data.enText: The rooms had all been cleaned and aired.
opinions
to express your opinions publicly

data.chText: 周会可以让雇员诉说他们的委屈。
data.enText: The weekly meeting enables employees to air their grievances .
radio/TV programme
to broadcast a programme on the radio or on television; to be broadcast

data.chText: 这个节目将在下周二夜间播出。
data.enText: The show will be aired next Tuesday night.
The program aired last week.
air out
air sth↔out

ex.chText: 没有空气就没有生命。
ex.enText: There would be no life without air.

ex.chText: 新鲜空气有益于健康。
ex.enText: Fresh air is beneficial to health.

synonyms.bx: 指人类所呼吸的地球上的气体。

ex.chText: 高层大气的作用有哪些？
ex.enText: What are the functions of the upper atmosphere?

ex.chText: 烟雾弥漫的空气使她感到头晕。
ex.enText: She felt dizzy in the smoky atmosphere.

synonyms.bx: 指围绕地球的大气层，或室内的空气。

ex.chText: 她喜欢在春风里散步。
ex.enText: She likes walking in a spring breeze.

ex.chText: 树下凉风宜人。
ex.enText: There is a lovely cool breeze under the trees.

synonyms.bx: 指因空气流动而生成的和风。

ex.chText: 这房间冬天有穿堂风。
ex.enText: The room has a draught in the winter.

ex.chText: 她坐在风口上，着凉了。
ex.enText: She sat in a draught and caught a cold.

synonyms.bx: 尤指室内等处寒冷的过堂风。

ex.chText: 要看一个人的行为而不是他的言辞。
ex.enText: It is a man's actions that matter, not his words.

ex.chText: 她为自己的行为感到歉疚。
ex.enText: She was sorry for her actions.

synonyms.bx: 指具体的或抽象的行为过程或所做之事。

ex.chText: 快活的神情
ex.enText: a cheerful air

ex.chText: 批评家的风度
ex.enText: the air of a critic

ex.chText: 这位候选人看着他的支持者们，神态坚定果断。
ex.enText: The candidate looked at his supporters with a determined air.

synonyms.bx: 作此义解时通常要加冠词，指一个人表现出来的风度、气派、面貌。

ex.chText: 军人的举止/傲慢的态度
ex.enText: a military/proud bearing

ex.chText: 新来的首席执行官气度不凡。
ex.enText: The new CEO has a distinguished bearing.

ex.chText: 后来她以饱含热情的笔触写到了他的举止和行为。
ex.enText: She later wrote warmly of his bearing and behaviour.

synonyms.bx: 尤指能够体现出性格特点的行为举止，如站立、行走的姿态等。

ex.chText: 仆人行为可嘉，被她留了下来。
ex.enText: She kept the servant because of his good conduct/behaviour.

ex.chText: 听到你在学校表现良好，我很高兴。
ex.enText: I'm glad to hear of your good conduct/behaviour at school.

synonyms.bx: 指人在某个地方或某种情况下的表现，尤指在公开场合、工作岗位上的行为，常可与 behaviour 换用。

ex.chText: 他对妻子态度粗暴。
ex.enText: He has a rude manner towards his wife.

ex.chText: 那个小女孩总是很有礼貌。
ex.enText: The little girl always has good manners.

ex.chText: 他是研究古人礼仪的专家。
ex.enText: He is an expert on the manners of the ancients.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指对待其他人的态度和行为方式，不涉及道德规范，仅指符合传统的礼仪和要求。其复数形式 manners 指礼貌、规矩，多用于社交活动。

ex.chText: 天空乌云密布。
ex.enText: The sky was full of dark clouds.

ex.chText: 天空中有几只鸟儿在飞翔。
ex.enText: There are some birds flying in the sky.

ex.chText: 英国春天的气候是温暖的。
ex.enText: English skies are temperate in spring.

synonyms.bx: 指广阔的天空或某一地区的上空，其复数形式 skies 主要用于描述天气或某处的天空情况。

ex.chText: 许多鸟儿在空中飞翔。
ex.enText: There were many birds flying in the air.

ex.chText: 飞机使人们能够在空中旅行。
ex.enText: Airplanes enable people to travel through the air.

ex.chText: 火苗蹿向空中。
ex.enText: Flames leapt into the air.

synonyms.bx: 指地面或某物的上方空间，常与定冠词 the 连用。

ex.chText: 雷声震撼了天宇。
ex.enText: The heavens shook with thunder.

ex.chText: 天文学家通过望远镜来观察天空。
ex.enText: The astronomer scanned the heavens through the telescope.

synonyms.bx: 表示此义时，通常用 the heavens 形式。

a way of behaving that shows that sb thinks that they are more important, etc. than they really are
float/walk on air
to feel very happy
in the air

There's romance in the air.

data.enText: We'll get a breath of fresh air at lunchtime.

data.chText: （通过倾诉）改变困境，缓解紧张状态，改善气氛

data.enText: I just plucked a figure out of the air and said : ‘Would £1 000 seem reasonable to you?’

air sth↔out

example: air travel involves too much waiting in airports
if you've time to spare go by air

tr: a distinctive but intangible quality surrounding a person or thing
example: an air of mystery
the house had a neglected air
an atmosphere of defeat pervaded the candidate's headquarters
the place had an aura of romance

tr: medium for radio and television broadcasting
example: the program was on the air from 9 til midnight
the president used the airwaves to take his message to the people

tr: a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence
example: she was humming an air from Beethoven

tr: the mass of air surrounding the Earth
example: there was great heat as the comet entered the atmosphere
it was exposed to the air
her hand stopped in mid air
he threw the ball into the air
the breeze was cooled by the lake
as he waited he could feel the air on his neck

tr: a mixture of gases (especially oxygen) required for breathing
the stuff that the wind consists of
example: air pollution
a smell of chemicals in the air
open a window and let in some air
I need some fresh air

tr: once thought to be one of four elements composing the universe (Empedocles)
expose to cool or cold air so as to cool or freshen
example: air the old winter clothes
air out the smoke-filled rooms

tr: expose to warm or heated air, so as to dry
example: Air linen
She aired her opinions on welfare

tr: broadcast over the airwaves, as in radio or television
example: We cannot air this X-rated song
This show will air Saturdays at 2 P.M.
aerate your old sneakers

value.def: Air is the mixture of gases which forms the earth's atmosphere and which we breathe.

example.ex: Draughts help to circulate air...
example.tran: 穿堂风有助于空气流通。

example.ex: Keith opened the window and leaned out into the cold air.
example.tran: 基思打开窗户，探出身到冷风中。

example.ex: ...water and air pollutants.
example.tran: 水污染物和空气污染物

value.def: The air is the space around things or above the ground.

example.ex: Government troops broke up the protest by firing their guns in the air...
example.tran: 政府军队朝天鸣枪驱散了抗议人群。

example.ex: People's cigarette smoke seemed to hang in the air.
example.tran: 人们吸烟的烟雾似乎会长时间滞留在空气中。

value.def: Air is used to refer to travel in aircraft.

example.ex: Air travel will continue to grow at about 6% per year...
example.tran: 乘飞机旅行的人数将以每年大约6%的速度持续增加。

example.ex: Casualties had to be brought to hospital by air.
example.tran: 伤者不得不用飞机送往医院。

value.def: An air is a simple tune which can be easily recognized and remembered.
If you say that someone or something has a particular air, you mean that they give this general impression.

example.ex: Jennifer regarded him with an air of amusement...
example.tran: 珍妮弗觉得他很风趣。

example.ex: The meal gave the occasion an almost festive air.
example.tran: 这一餐使整个场合有了近乎节日般的喜庆氛围。

value.tran: 神态;感觉;总体印象;氛围

value.def: If you say that someone is putting on airs or giving themselves airs, you are criticizing them for behaving as if they are better than other people.

example.ex: We're poor and we never put on airs.
example.tran: 我们贫穷但从不装腔作势。

value.tran: 矫揉造作；装腔作势；做作

value.def: If a broadcasting company airs a television or radio programme, they show it on television or broadcast it on the radio.

example.ex: Tonight PBS will air a documentary called 'Democracy In Action'.
example.tran: 今晚公共广播公司将播放一部名为《民主进行时》的纪录片。

value.tran: （通过电视或无线电）播送，播放

example.ex: ...the airing of offensive material.
example.tran: 冒犯性音像资料的播放

value.def: If you air your opinions, you make them known to people.

example.ex: They sat for more than six hours, and both sides agreed they had aired all their differences...
example.tran: 他们一起坐了六个多小时，而且双方都认为他们已经表达了所有的不同意见。

example.ex: The whole issue was thoroughly aired at the meeting.
example.tran: 在会上完全公开了整个问题。

example.ex: While we're able to broach the subject of sex, money rarely gets an airing.
example.tran: 虽然我们能公开讨论性的话题，但却很少谈及金钱的问题。

value.def: If you air a room or building, you let fresh air into it.

example.ex: One day a week her mother systematically cleaned and aired each room.
example.tran: 她母亲按部就班地每周一次清扫所有的房间并开窗通风。

example.ex: Open all the windows of the bedroom and give it a good airing.
example.tran: 打开卧室的所有窗户，让它好好通通风。

value.def: If you air clothing or bedding, you put it somewhere warm to make sure that it is completely dry.

example.ex: When the shirts were clean, I ironed them myself, aired them and placed them in drawers in his room.
example.tran: 衬衫洗干净之后，我自己将它们熨好、烘干并放在他房间的抽屉里。

value.def: If you do something to clear the air, you do it in order to resolve any problems or disagreements that there might be.

example.ex: ...an inquiry just to clear the air and settle the facts of the case.
example.tran: 一项只为消除疑团并弄清案件事实而进行的调查

value.def: If you refer to someone's airs and graces, you mean that they behave in a way that shows that they think they are more important than other people.

example.ex: The old cliché of the customer being always right is what gives them airs and graces.
example.tran: “顾客总是对的”这种陈词滥调让他们变得趾高气扬。

value.tran: 大模大样;摆架子;装腔作势

value.def: If something is in the air it is felt to be present, but it is not talked about.

example.ex: There was great excitement in the air...
example.tran: 人人都感到无比激动。

example.ex: She walked away and left the question hanging in the air.
example.tran: 她走开了，将疑问留在人们心里。

value.def: If someone is on the air, they are broadcasting on radio or television. If a programme is on the air, it is being broadcast on radio or television. If it is off the air, it is not being broadcast.

example.ex: She is going on the air as presenter of a new show...
example.tran: 她即将上电视主持一档新节目。

example.ex: Rockwell hopes the program can be on the air within a year...
example.tran: 罗克韦尔希望该节目能在一年内播出。

example.ex: This message did not reach me until after the programme went off the air.
example.tran: 直到节目播出后，我才获知这条消息。

value.tran: 播送（广播、电视节目）；（广播、电视节目）播放/停止播放

value.def: If someone or something disappears into thin air, they disappear completely. If someone or something appears out of thin air, they appear suddenly and mysteriously.

example.ex: 'But where could they have gone?' he demanded. 'They can't just vanish into thin air!'...
example.tran: “但是他们可能去哪里呢？”他追问道，“他们不可能就神秘消失了!”

example.ex: He had materialized out of thin air; I had not seen or heard him coming.
example.tran: 他突然间神秘地出现了；我既没看见他来，也没听见他的脚步声。

value.tran: （消失得）无影无踪/突然神秘地（出现）

value.def: If you say that a decision or a situation is up in the air, you mean that it has not yet been completely settled or planned.

example.ex: He told reporters today that the president's trip to Moscow is up in the air.
example.tran: 今天他告诉记者们总统是否前往莫斯科尚未确定。

value.def: If you say that you are walking on air or floating on air, you mean that you feel extremely happy about something.

example.ex: As soon as I know I'm in the team it's like I'm walking on air.
example.tran: 一得知我加入了这个队，我高兴得像飞上了天。

trans: 空军一号(美国总统的专用座机)
(飞机飞越外国领空时获准使用的)空中走廊
虚拟吉他(尤指听摇滚乐时佯装弹吉他的动作)
